about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should:

about.name: If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should: | If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If your vehicle becomes disabled, you must (if possible) park with all four wheels off of the main-traveled portion of the road.

comment.text: Stop in the right lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Park with all four wheels off the traveled highway, if possible.

comment.text: Park with all four wheels off the traveled highway, if possible.
Stop where you are.

acceptedAnswer.text: Park with all four wheels off the traveled highway, if possible.

comment.text: Park with all four wheels off the traveled highway, if possible.

answerExplanation.text: If your vehicle becomes disabled, you must (if possible) park with all four wheels off of the main-traveled portion of the road.

comment.text: If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should: | If your vehicle becomes disabled, you must (if possible) park with all four wheels off of the main-traveled portion of the road.

hasPart.name: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic:

about.name: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic:

hasPart.assesses: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic: | When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing is permitted from the left.

comment.text: Passing is permitted from the left.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing is permitted from the right.

comment.text: Passing is permitted from the right.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing is not permitted from either direction.

comment.text: Passing is not permitted from either direction.

acceptedAnswer.text: Passing is not permitted from either direction.

comment.text: Passing is not permitted from either direction.

answerExplanation.text: Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

comment.text: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic: | Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

hasPart.name: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:

about.name: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:

hasPart.assesses: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted: | Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely. This includes alcohol, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications, and illegal drugs.

comment.text: Under no circumstances.
If you don't feel drowsy.

suggestedAnswer.text: If it is prescribed by a physician.

comment.text: If it is prescribed by a physician.
Under no circumstances.

answerExplanation.text: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely. This includes alcohol, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications, and illegal drugs.

comment.text: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted: | It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely. This includes alcohol, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications, and illegal drugs.

hasPart.name: Drivers are required to obey instructions from:

about.name: Drivers are required to obey instructions from:

hasPart.assesses: Drivers are required to obey instructions from: | Drivers are required to obey instructions from: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers must obey special signs or instructions given by flaggers. They are in place to keep drivers and workers safe.

comment.text: Security guards patrolling parking lots.

suggestedAnswer.text: Other drivers whose vehicles are broken down on the roadway.

comment.text: Other drivers whose vehicles are broken down on the roadway.
Flaggers (signal persons) at construction sites.
Flaggers (signal persons) at construction sites.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers must obey special signs or instructions given by flaggers. They are in place to keep drivers and workers safe.

comment.text: Drivers are required to obey instructions from: | Drivers must obey special signs or instructions given by flaggers. They are in place to keep drivers and workers safe.

hasPart.name: Collisions are more likely to happen when:

about.name: Collisions are more likely to happen when:

hasPart.assesses: Collisions are more likely to happen when: | Collisions are more likely to happen when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

suggestedAnswer.text: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.

comment.text: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.

suggestedAnswer.text: One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.

comment.text: One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.

suggestedAnswer.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

comment.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

comment.text: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

answerExplanation.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

comment.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when: | Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

hasPart.name: A school bus is stopped ahead of you in your lane with its red lights flashing. You should:

about.name: A school bus is stopped ahead of you in your lane with its red lights flashing. You should:

hasPart.assesses: A school bus is stopped ahead of you in your lane with its red lights flashing. You should: | A school bus is stopped ahead of you in your lane with its red lights flashing. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When a stopped school bus is using its flashing red lights, approaching drivers must stop and remain stopped until the lights stop flashing. If the school bus is on the opposite side of a divided highway, drivers do not need to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus.

comment.text: Stop and proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow to 25 mph and pass cautiously.

comment.text: Slow to 25 mph and pass cautiously.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop for as long as the red lights are flashing.

comment.text: Stop for as long as the red lights are flashing.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop for as long as the red lights are flashing.

comment.text: Stop for as long as the red lights are flashing.

answerExplanation.text: When a stopped school bus is using its flashing red lights, approaching drivers must stop and remain stopped until the lights stop flashing. If the school bus is on the opposite side of a divided highway, drivers do not need to stop.

comment.text: A school bus is stopped ahead of you in your lane with its red lights flashing. You should: | When a stopped school bus is using its flashing red lights, approaching drivers must stop and remain stopped until the lights stop flashing. If the school bus is on the opposite side of a divided highway, drivers do not need to stop.
